comments.body:
These steps got apache using php 8.1
- a2enmod php8.1
- a2dismod php7.4
- restart apache

Then, @christinach and @kevinreiss and I did these steps to get the necessary php modules:
- apt-get install -y php8.1-mysql php8.1-mbstring php8.1-gd # we can hopefully get this included in the playbook.
- restart apache

princeton_ansible.title: [Bibdata] Remove stale apt ruby versions in bibdata when running the ruby_s role. Install ruby 3.1

comments.body: rebase this when #3414 is merged

Today when I re ran the playbook I noticed that even though we specify bundler version 2.3.24 , it installed 2.3.25 which was released today Nov 2nd. It didn't create any problem when I deployed the app.
Closing for now. We may revisit in future.

princeton_ansible.title: updates ruby_s role to support upgrades, ease idempotency

comments.body: I meant to add this comment in this pr https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/pull/3373#issuecomment-1301065281
The ruby_s role does not reliably install the specified version of `bundler`, we're not sure why.
This won't pass CI until the changes in #3414 are merged and this PR is rebased.

@kayiwa @christinach I think these lines can just be updated to reference {{ php_version }}, rather than hard-coded php7.4: https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/blob/main/roles/drupal/tasks/main.yml#L7-L10

That will also bring in the `php8.1-xml` package, which is needed for the special_collections site.

comments.body:
This seems to require VPN.  And I got an unsafe warning on my browser

Also I had to double click on the icons on the side for them to open

For context, this is the error. I'd prefer to hold off on this until the error can be resolved. I'll ask on slack if there's someone we can reach out to...

> Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead
> 
> Firefox detected an issue and did not continue to arca.rc.princeton.edu. The website is either misconfigured or your computer clock is set to the wrong time.
> 
> It’s likely the website’s certificate is expired, which prevents Firefox from connecting securely. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details.
> 
> What can you do about it?
> 
> The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

I was able to login without VPN, but I think for uploading files you need to be on the VPN (?)

I was able to "create an asset", it's under collection "samples3/net/hector-test-three" but it has no content. 

Eventually I was able to add content (a file) by dragging and dropping a file (thanks @kelynch) -- this feature is rather finicky, sometimes it works, other times it does not. I think you need to NOT have the DTI thingy running for the feature to work but I am not 100% sure about this.
